author: James Fieldsend
comment: Crashes instantly on Moto 360 Gen 1. EDIT: Don't even get a message, it just crashes the whole watch and won't turn on again without me putting it on the charger. If you think it's incompatible, I'll remove the review.

reply.author: Matthew Burton
reply.content: Are you able to get to the app after the crash message? For some reason it also happens on my Moto 360, but after the crash message, it works just fine. EDIT Sorry to hear that! It should be compatible, but I'm going to submit an update next week that should fix issues like those. Appreciate the bug report :D

author: Twisted World
comment: Very nice minimalistic but futuristic watch face! The Android app on my Asus Padfone crashes at launch instantly, but fortunately the app on my Asus Zenwatch 3 is running okay! Would be five stars if the companion app on my mobile would work though. :-)

reply.author: Matthew Burton
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. Looking into fixing the phone app ryenaow!

author: Jon Winn
comment: Worked good on my Zenwatch 2 before the AW2 update. After that this app made my watch completely unusable. The cpu was always tied up making the watch unresponsive to touch.  Eventually I got it uninstalled and now the watch works great and responds to touch.

reply.author: Matthew Burton
reply.content: Sorry it borked you watch for a bit. If you do by chance reinstall, plz lemme know if it works with the latest AW2. Thanks!

author: Andrew Cantu
comment: I don't think that this app it's nougat compatible yet, because when I open the app on my Pixel it crashes without and crash reports and it wouldnt sync with my moto360 2 gen. I would like this use this and I will change my review once I can use it but I do like the concept

reply.author: Matthew Burton
reply.content: EDIT: I just tested on a Nexus 9 running Android 7.1 and it worked. It may be Google Pixel Compatability issue. Do you by chance have another device you could try on? Also, are you sure the watch app didn't sync to your watch? The app would be in the app section, not the watchfaces section. Thanks

author: Arik Licholat
comment: A really fun, short game that you can play on your watch. And the watch face on the "menu" screen is really nice looking! I want it to become an actual watch face.

author: Adil Yitiz
comment: Crashes after install on moto 360 2nd, twice, then works just fine. Great app.

author: Randy Bolton
comment: Flappy Bird for your smartwatch! A fun, simple, avoidance game that is ideally suited for a watchface. Great job!

author: jonathan moss
comment: On Google pixel and instantly crashes

reply.author: Matthew Burton
reply.content: Issue with Nougat (7.0) Sorry! I'll update you once it's fixed. Thanks!

author: Paul Vidal
comment: Great game! The watch face feature is nice and it works flawlessly on the ZenWatch 2. Kudos to the developer!

author: Ki Talbot
comment: Awesome idea and awesome game. I would love it if it had a digital clock option too

reply.author: Matthew Burton
reply.content: DUUUDE. I was tinkering with the idea of making a digital one. Now I'm going to for sure

reply.author: Matthew Burton
reply.content: True, however it does support ambient mode so that you can use it as a watchface without draining battery. Had to make it an app to support the game functionality. Thanks for playing :D

author: Shady Squid
comment: cant open, crashes on samsing s7 and wont download to moto 360 gen 2

author: Alpha Prion
comment: Great to see it on a watch, but would much rather it be an interactive watch face

author: Kornél Várkonyi
comment: Fun game. I hope it would be a watch face

author: Dan R
comment: I want to see the watch face independent.

author: James Macanufo
comment: Why settle for just a clock.
